---
title: "Italian Polls"
author: "Tauheed"
date: "October 1, 2018"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
raw <- read_csv("polls_IT-parliament_2018-10-01.csv")
```



```{r, message=FALSE}
raw %>% select(date, firm, n, LN, M5S, FIPDLFI, PD) %>% filter(date >= "2017-09-26") %>%
  gather(key = "party", value = "poll", LN, M5S, FIPDLFI, PD) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = poll, color = party)) + geom_smooth() + geom_point(size = 0.5, alpha = 0.1)

```
Purpose of this document is to show polling results in Italy.
